content: Could all the #align lines in Mathlib be moved to a separate file? I think they hinder readability and they don't need to come right after respective declarations.
It makes maintenance harder if there is a parallel file that has to be kept up to date
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
(I'm hoping that by then we will have better lean4 -> lean4 migration mechanisms)

Slightly off-topic, but: When will mathlib3 be archived? There are 28 not-too-late open PRs, but none of them have been touched since October 18th and the last merged not-too-late PR was on October 30th.
#8007 finally synced a few of those
Though Yaël landed a forward port just now
#outofsync is no longer automatically updated; someone needs to volunteer to grab a GitHub API token and run the script in the mathlib repo

Mauricio Collares said:

Slightly off-topic, but: When will mathlib3 be archived? There are 28 not-too-late open PRs, but none of them have been touched since October 18th and the last merged not-too-late PR was on October 30th.

Archiving feels like an unhelpful step to me; even if we draw a "no more PRs will ever be merged" line, archiving prevents people pushing their local work to branches, and prevents commenting on open PRs issues to reference forward-ports etc. I don't think that's a price worth paying to move the orange banner up a few hundred pixels
Makes sense. I was mainly thinking of a possible "no more PRs merged" deadline, so I think I agree.
